questions.question: What is Client-Side Rendering (CSR)?
options: Rendering content directly in the browser using JavaScript
Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client
Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
questions.answer: Rendering content directly in the browser using JavaScript

questions.question: What is a major disadvantage of CSR?
options: Slower initial page load
Increased server load
Not suitable for highly dynamic content

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of CSR?
options: Fast subsequent page loads
Better SEO
Reduced server load

questions.question: What is Server-Side Rendering (SSR)?
options: Rendering content directly in the browser using JavaScript
Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client
Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
questions.answer: Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of SSR?
options: Faster initial page load
Fast subsequent page loads
Reduced server load

questions.question: What is a major disadvantage of SSR?
options: Increased server load
Less SEO-friendly
Not suitable for highly dynamic content

questions.question: What is Static Site Generation (SSG)?
options: Rendering content directly in the browser using JavaScript
Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client
Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
questions.answer: Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of SSG?
options: Fast page load times
Fast subsequent page loads
Reduced server load

questions.question: What is a major disadvantage of SSG?
options: Increased server load
Less SEO-friendly
Not suitable for highly dynamic content
questions.answer: Not suitable for highly dynamic content

questions.question: What is Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR)?
options: A feature of Next.js that allows for the regeneration of static pages at runtime
Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client
Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
questions.answer: A feature of Next.js that allows for the regeneration of static pages at runtime

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of ISR?
options: Serves the most recent content
Fast subsequent page loads
Reduced server load

questions.question: What is a disadvantage of ISR compared to SSG?
options: Slightly slower page serve/render time
Increased server load
Less SEO-friendly

questions.question: What is the main purpose of React Server Components?
options: To build modern user interfaces while improving performance
To generate static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
To render content on the server and send the fully rendered HTML to the client
questions.answer: To build modern user interfaces while improving performance

questions.question: What is the main idea behind Islands Architecture?
options: Selectively hydrating UI components on an otherwies static HTML page. Each island renders in isolation, allowing multiple islands to exist on a page without affecting each other.
Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client
questions.answer: Selectively hydrating UI components on an otherwies static HTML page. Each island renders in isolation, allowing multiple islands to exist on a page without affecting each other.

questions.question: What is the main goal of partial hydration?
options: Hydrating parts of a server-rendered page with JavaScript to reduce the amount of code needed for interactivity
Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client
questions.answer: Hydrating parts of a server-rendered page with JavaScript to reduce the amount of code needed for interactivity

questions.question: What is the main idea behind Hybrid Rendering?
options: Combining build-time, server, and client rendering to create a more flexible approach to web development
Generating static HTML pages for each possible view during the build process
Rendering content on the server and sending the fully rendered HTML to the client
questions.answer: Combining build-time, server, and client rendering to create a more flexible approach to web development
